bullets.text: U.S. payrolls rose 50,000 in December; unemployment 4.4%. Hiring momentum slowed, pointing to a cooler labor market entering 2026.
U.S. begins buying ~$200B in mortgage bonds; mortgage rates fall below 6% for first time in ~3 years, potentially stimulating housing and refinancing.
Fed’s Z.1 Financial Accounts updated through 2025 Q3, offering fresh read on household net worth, debt, and sectoral leverage.
E.U. and Mercosur move toward a 700M-person free-trade zone, likely boosting cross-Atlantic investment while sparking disputes over agriculture and environmental standards.
Trump says oil majors may invest $100B in Venezuela under U.S. protection, potentially increasing supply but entangling sanctions policy with Caracas politics.
Trump threatens to take Greenland “whether they like it or not,” raising NATO frictions and spotlighting Arctic security, minerals, and shipping lanes.
Iran faces a second night of nationwide protests amid inflation and currency stress, increasing domestic instability and adding to regional geopolitical and energy risks.
Putin’s missile strike on Ukraine is cast as a warning to Europe, intensifying escalation concerns and supporting higher European defense spending.
Meta signs nuclear deals exceeding 6 GW to power AI compute, highlighting electricity as a binding constraint and accelerating nuclear’s role in tech infrastructure.
OpenAI and SoftBank commit $1B to SB Energy, underscoring how AI expansion is driving large-scale investment in power generation and grids.
Andreessen Horowitz raises $15B with emphasis on infrastructure and defense, signaling renewed investor appetite for capital-intensive, strategically aligned technologies.
Study links common food preservatives to higher type 2 diabetes risk, potentially affecting regulation, product reformulation, and long-run healthcare costs.
